013package org.apache.juneau.cp;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.collections.JsonMap.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ArgUtils.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ClassUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.internal.StringUtils.*;
019
020import java.util.function.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
024
025/**
026 * Represents a bean in a {@link BeanStore}.
027 *
028 * <p>
029 * A bean entry consists of the following:
030 * <ul>
031 *    <li>A class type.
032 *    <li>A bean or bean supplier that returns an instance of the class type.  This can be a subclass of the type.
033 *    <li>An optional name.
034 * </ul>
035 *
036 * @param <T> The bean type.
037 */
038public class BeanStoreEntry<T> {
039
040   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
041   // Static
042   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
043
044   /**
045    * Static creator.
046    *
047    * @param <T> The class type to associate with the bean.
048    * @param type The class type to associate with the bean.
049    * @param bean The bean supplier.
050    * @param name Optional name to associate with the bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
051    * @return A new bean store entry.
052    */
053   public static <T> BeanStoreEntry<T> create(Class<T> type, Supplier<T> bean, String name) {
054      return new BeanStoreEntry<>(type, bean, name);
055   }
056
057   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
058   // Instance
059   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
060
061   final Supplier<T> bean;
062   final Class<T> type;
063   final String name;
064
065   /**
066    * Constructor.
067    *
068    * @param type The class type to associate with the bean.
069    * @param bean The bean supplier.
070    * @param name Optional name to associate with the bean.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
071    */
072   protected BeanStoreEntry(Class<T> type, Supplier<T> bean, String name) {
073      this.bean = assertArgNotNull("bean", bean);
074      this.type = assertArgNotNull("type", type);
075      this.name = nullIfEmpty(name);
076   }
077
078   /**
079    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this bean is exactly of the specified type.
080    *
081    * @param type The class to check.  Returns <jk>false</jk> if <jk>null</jk>.
082    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this bean is exactly of the specified type.
083    */
084   public boolean matches(Class<?> type) {
085      return this.type.equals(type);
086   }
087
088   /**
089    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this bean is exactly of the specified type and has the specified name.
090    *
091    * @param type The class to check.  Returns <jk>false</jk> if <jk>null</jk>.
092    * @param name The name to check.  Can be <jk>null</jk> to only match if name of entry is <jk>null</jk>.
093    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this bean is exactly of the specified type and has the specified name.
094    */
095   public boolean matches(Class<?> type, String name) {
096      name = nullIfEmpty(name);
097      return matches(type) && StringUtils.eq(this.name, name);
098   }
099
100   /**
101    * Returns the bean associated with this entry.
102    *
103    * @return The bean associated with this entry.
104    */
105   public T get() {
106      return bean.get();
107   }
108
109   /**
110    * Returns the type this bean is associated with.
111    *
112    * @return The type this bean is associated with.
113    */
114   public Class<T> getType() {
115      return type;
116   }
117
118   /**
119    * Returns the name associated with this entry.
120    *
121    * @return the name associated with this entry.  <jk>null</jk> if no name is associated.
122    */
123   public String getName() {
124      return name;
125   }
126
127   /**
128    * Returns the properties in this object as a simple map for debugging purposes.
129    *
130    * @return The properties in this object as a simple map.
131    */
132   protected JsonMap properties() {
133      return filteredMap()
134         .append("type", simpleClassName(getType()))
135         .append("bean", ObjectUtils.identity(get()))
136         .append("name", getName());
137   }
138}
